snippet: The lawyer for Pvt. Bradley Manning, who is accused of leaking secret government documents, argued Tuesday that his client was unjustly subjected to harsh conditions for nine months while he awaits trial.
abstract: Lawyers for Pfc Bradley Manning, who is accused of leaking confidential documents to Wikileaks, continue to argue that he suffered abuse at the hands of his jailors at Quantico Marine prison; military prosecutors argue that Manning was isolated and deprived of certain belongings because officials feared he was suicidal.
lead_paragraph: The lawyer for Pvt. Bradley Manning, who is accused of leaking secret government documents, argued Tuesday that his client was unjustly subjected to harsh conditions for nine months while he awaits trial.

headline.seo: WikiLeaks Case Lawyer Chides Marine Jailers on Manning’s Treatment
headline.main: WikiLeaks Case Lawyer Chides Marine Jailers on Manning’s Treatment
headline.print_headline: WikiLeaks Case Lawyer Chides Marine Jailers On Manning’s Treatment
